title: Liverpool airport set for terminal upgrade
text:
Liverpool airport set for terminal upgrade 18 August 2015 
Liverpool airport is set to benefit from a major investment programme after its owners secured a new long-term agreement with lenders. 
The airport’s bank debt has been reduced with funding committed to improve the passenger terminal. 
In the first half of 2015 passenger numbers have grown by 6% and in the 2013-14 financial year the airport made an operating profit of £2.4 million. 
Steven Underwood, chief executive of owners The Peel Group, said: “We are delighted to have secured this new deal, which has allowed us to commit to the new investment programme. The future of Liverpool John Lennon Airport is strategically important to Peel, the wider city-region and, indeed, the Northern Powerhouse as a whole.” 
Andrew Cornish, chief executive of Liverpool airport, said: “This is an exciting time for the Airport and Peel’s latest commitment will help to ensure that whilst continuing to grow the business further by offering our passengers more choice of airlines and destinations, we can give them the best possible passenger experience too, cementing our position as the Airport the region loves.”
